data.title: It seem that Pianoteq has inspire Eric Persing... (Page 1)
data.meta_description: It seem that Pianoteq has inspire Eric Persing... (Page 1) - Pianoteq user forum - Modartt user forum -
data.text:
Hi all,

It seem that Pianoteq has inspire Eric Persing...

Bonjour à tous,

Il semblerait que Pianoteq ait inspiré Eric Persing, Omnisphere, Trilian,etc...

Flow Capture

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kj0w7FhbcWA

(Thanks "brundleflyfor" for remind me there was no link)

Last edited by imyself (21-09-2022 20:50)

Thanks imyself,

Check out the appreciation shown by the Yutube commenters, for that kind of feature.

Gotta also input here - there's nothing new about 'exporting to project' files ready for production - it's mostly about implementation.. and paramount to this, they have included the extra useful little super-power ability to drag-drop so that THE same preset used plays back the MIDI (no user sweat to match it up).

It's seemingly a tiny thing.. but is so very useful to so very many.

It would be good to have something like it, for Pianoteq.. and hopefully, the most frictionless 'way' to do it I think was simple when painted out in this recent forum thread - I put forward a here simple/doable 'token' system - LINK - to achieve it (*token in MIDI file - and well perhaps also audio - to load up the correct piano/preset). Just days ago wow.

Definitely like imyself wonders if Pianoteq forum inspired it.. I do wonder if Eric had his Pianoteq forum reading goggles on too

Pianoteq Studio Bundle (Pro plus all instruments) - Kawai MP11 digital piano - Yamaha HS8 monitors
